title: San Francisco Joints
name: San Francisco Joints
description:
A Map by Finkster

Many have wondered where I actually go in The City and when I travel around the world...some have even asked...but even if you haven't, it's finally here...my favorite experiences in the San Francisco Bay Area, and my favorite joints around the world.

This is my guide to the best places to eat, drink, and tour in The City.  And yes...there is only one city here, and if you have to ask, hit the back button on your browser now.

I've tried all these places myself, and they are all fantastic, so don't ask which place I like best.  This list is still in progress, many more to come soon.

For more ideas, mistersf.com has a lot of great other ideas as he combs the City for interesting joints.

properties.name: 21st Amendment
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 563 2nd St, San Francisco, CAReservations not typically needed except gamedays, available by phone at (415) 369-0900. Easy to eat at the bar. Pure local brew! Looking to get away from Gordon Biersch or Anchor Steam, this is your place. You\'ll find me here on weeknights, also a great place to go before the game. Outdoor beer garden during gamedays. If you love IPA, you\'ll love 21st. Also try their Watermelon Wheat if it\'s summer, a great light summer beer. The food is also excellent, can\'t go wrong here.

properties.name: A 16
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2355 Chestnut Street, San Francisco, CaliforniaReservations (OpenTable.com) Recognized as possibly the best Italian restaurant in the country, and I absolutely can\'t disagree. Make sure you go as a very small crowd, it\'s very difficult to get the same experience with a large party. Surprisingly inexpensive for the quality, and an absolutely stunning Italian wine list...make sure to try the Lambrusco if they have it, it has finally matured as a sparkling red wine of quality and is delightful. My last visit really was exquisite, their salumi that is locally dry aged is fantastic, as is their prosciutto selection. If you\'ve never experienced Burrata cream filled Mozarella, you\'re in for a particular treat. Also a fantastic Bergamont Orange sorbet (think Earl Grey tea) for dessert that was astonishing in flavor and creativity. You simply won\'t find boring Italian food, simply put you will have the finest flavor balancing and perfectly cooked meats, homemade pizzas and pastas as well.

properties.name: Aqua
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 252 California St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) High end contemporary seafood, very romantic ambience. Pricey, but a must try in the City.

properties.name: Aziza
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 5800 Geary Boulevard, San Francisco, CA, 94121Reservations (OpenTable.com) Wonderful Moroccan and Mediterranean food with a california influence in an absolutely fabulously cool environment. One of my favorites for inventive food, and a great time. And yes...they do have belly dancers!

properties.name: Bacar Restaurant & Wine Salon
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 448 Brannan Street, San Francisco, CA, 94107Reservations (OpenTable.com) Another neighborhood joint of mine....great wine bar and jazz joint, and oh yeah the food is quite good. Not the best value for the money for entrees, but appetizers and pizzas are great. Overall a great experience.

properties.name: Barbara's Fish Trap
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 281 Capistrano Rd, Half Moon Bay, CA281 Capistrano Rd Half Moon Bay, CA 94019 A local favorite for "naked" prepared fish. Simple and great quality fish, no frills. Inexpensive, not fancy. Be prepared for a line, no reservations.

properties.name: Bi-Rite Creamery
properties.description: Posted by Finkster3692 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94110Small batch ice creamery

properties.name: Bistro Jeantry
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 6510 Washington St, Yountville, CAReservations by phone only (707) 944-0103 Sister restaurant to Jeanty at Jack\'s, this extraordinarily quaint French bistro is as traditional as country French cuisine gets. Don\'t miss this gem of a restaurant in the Napa Valley before or after your wine tasting.

properties.name: Bourbon & Branch
properties.description: Posted by Finkster501 Jones St, San Francisco, CAPrivate 1920s speakeasy...not even so much a sign on the door. You think they don\'t want onlookers....you\'re right, so make sure to make a reservation on their website. One of the cooler high end cocktail experiences in they city, you\'ll find hundreds of drinks you\'ve never tried but should. Specializing in high end ingredients and rare bottles, this place makes perfectly mixed drinks to match the impeccable 20\'s decor.

properties.name: Bubble Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Finkster714 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) This is the place to start or end a classy evening...dimly lit romantic room where you can get bubbles, strawberries and chocolate! Best to reserve (yes even for drinks) in order to get a couch area to relax and drink your very expensive champagne cocktails.

properties.name: Burma Super Star
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 309 Clement St, San Francisco, CANO Reservations Amazing Burmese food...no surprise with the name, and inexpensive. Very difficult to get into, so plan ahead for a line or get there early!

properties.name: Cafe Gibraltar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  425 Avenue Alhambra, Half Moon Bay, CAReservations: None for parties of 4 or less...but you can call (650) 560-9039 on the day of to get on the list. Simply one of the finest restaurants in the Bay Area, in tiny little Half Moon Bay near the Princeton Harbor. Serving Mediterranean food, this is home cooking at its finest. You have to try this place at least once, it\'s worth the drive.

properties.name: Cafe Intermezzo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  2442 Telegraph Ave, Berkeley, CACafe Intermezzo (510) 849-4592

properties.name: Cafe for All Seasons
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  150 West Portal, San Francisco, CAReservations: None needed for breakfast, but expect a wait if you come in late. Dinner reservations by calling (415) 665-0900 Excellent neighorhood breakfast cafe, wonderful california style breakfast. Also serves an excellent dinner. One of the Chronicle Bay Area top 100 regularly. Try their Fried Polenta with pepper apple smoked Bacon, also their salads are excellent.

properties.name: Cav Wine Bar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1666 Market St, San Francisco, CASF Gate Wine Bars #1 SF Gate Wine Bars #2

properties.name: Cetrella
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 845 Main St, Half Moon Bay, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Newer "super restaurant" serving wonderul Mediterranean cuisine, certainly one of the top Med restaurants in the Bay Area. Also a lovely bar area with Jazz music regularly, eating off the bar menu and tuning out is just great here. Started by the chef of Rose Pistola.

properties.name: Cha Cha Cha
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2327 Mission St, San Francisco, CAReservations: Phone only (415) 648-0504 What can I say? Patatas Bravas...Sangria....Mojitos...Yum. No better place for drinks on a weekend and some Tapas.

properties.name: Chez Nous
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1911 Filmore St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com)

properties.name: Circa
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2001 Chestnut St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Sexy lounge styled restaurant, great bead curtains. Food is good quality, but expensive. Circa turns into a happening bar/lounge after 10 or so, keep your table until late in the evening to have a place to sit and hold court. Good small plates: Poached shrimp, sliders, mac and cheese, fat-iron steak.

properties.name: District Wine Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Finkster216 Townsend, San Francisco, CAYet another new SOMA Wine Lounge, serving great small plates and dinner food. More lounge with couches and curtains than restaurant, translates into to great after work SOMA crowd Wed-Fri.

properties.name: Ebisu
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1283 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA, 94122NO Reservations - walk in waitlist only Best Sushi in the City...hands down. Nothing more to say, simply the freshest fish and the best Sushi chefs. Definitely sit at the bar, and don\'t be afraid to provide beer to the chefs!

properties.name: Erna's Elderberry House
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 48688 Victoria Lane, Oakhurst, CA 93644Phone: (559) 683-6800 Simply put Erna\'s is the only high quality dining experience near or in Yosemite...however the price is very elevated as it is up in the remote reaches and is truly in a class of its own. Expect to spend 0/person for the menu and 0 for a 3 or 0 for a 6 wine flight per person. As a pure prix fixe menu, Erna\'s provides a unique menu each evening offering up to 6 courses to choose from. Erna\'s is connected to it\'s sister establishment Chateau du Sureau, which is simply one of the finest upscale bed and breakfasts in California, far outclassing it\'s local "in Yosemite park" competition at the Ahwahnee Lodge which is highly overrated IMO. Anyone staying at the hotel automatically gets reservations each evening (you don\'t have to use them). Otherwise you must call for reservations. The wine is a bit pricey considered it is mostly locally grown and normally inexpensive, but you will get good pairings, and certainly wines from the central valley you will not have tried before. Loved the Westbrook wine farm Viognier-Valdiguie Madera 2005, and the St. Amant Tempranillo Amador 2004. A few tips on the food, I prefer picking a smaller menu of their better preparations as their appetizer, salad and desserts are not at all inspiring. So here\'s what I did....the amuse is always creative, their soup chef is a genius and is always simply phenomenal, and their meats are so incredibly juicy and tender. Some menus I had when I went there: #1: * Amuse: Crispy veal sweet breads with caraway and water chestnuts in goulash sauce * Pan seared sea bass fillet and red cabbage risotto with baby carrots, bok choy and pecorino romano in a bleeding heart radish broth * Roasted parsnip soup with goose dumpling and chive crepes * Herb crusted rack of lamb, lentils, boudin noir and puntarelle, rosewater glazed asparagus, juniper lamb jus * Salad of young field greens, marinated Belgian endive and artichokes, savory-black pepper vinaigrette * Dark chocolate mousse cake and toasted pecan creme caramel #2: * Amuse: Venison pate, lingonberry coulis, spiced pecans * Acorn squash soup, smoked potato beignet, white truffle foam * Sliced pork tenderloin, glazed mustard spatzle, braised baby leeks and red cabbage, fennel seed-pork jus

properties.name: Farmer Brown
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 25 Mason St, San Francisco, CAChronicle review Phone: (415) 409-3276 Hearty soul food in the bustling downtown financial district...very hip atmosphere.

properties.name: Firefly
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4288 24th St, san francisco, caWarm and inviting, with a young lived in atmosphere in Noe Valley. Excellent southern flavor cuisine, you\'re bound to find black eyed peas and greens in some of the dishes, but also with a fusion flare. Also had a quite interesting crispy risotto cakes filled with goat cheese.

properties.name: Foreign Cinema
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  2534 Mission St, San Francisco, CA, 94110Reservations (OpenTable.com) Very good ambience...all concrete building inside of an old theater space. On the outside patio, black and white foreign films are projected on the wall. Great california fusion cuisine. Don\'t forget to stop in the adjoining bar outside, Laszlo\'s Bar, it\'s a Russian Communist style bar, and they serve great cocktails.

properties.name: Frisson
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 244 Jackson St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Elegant contemporary dining, French and American cuisine. I have to say they had some of the most innovative flavor blends, wonderful starters, and in particular very interesting sorbets for dessert.

properties.name: Grand Pu Bah
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 88 Division St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Guaymas
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 5 Main St, Tiburon, CAReservations by phone only at (415) 435-6300 Authentic Mexican food with a beatiful on the bay location right at the Tiburon Ferry dock...great margaritas and Tomalitos. Make sure to visit Sam\'s for drinks next door as well on a sunny day and sit out on the deck. A great weekend destination on the way to Angel Island as well.

properties.name: Jack Falstaff
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 598 2nd St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Urban cozy comfort food....soul food with a california cuisine twist. You\'ll love the leather on the walls and the clean design lines in the restaurant making a vibrant but relaxed atmosphere in a slow food tradition. Only local produce used, and used creatively. Close to the ballpark, this is a warm and comforting with very creative dishes.

properties.name: Jardiniere
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 300 Grove Street, San Francisco, CA, 94102Reservations (OpenTable.com) High end French cuisine for those of you needing a good Foie Gras fix. Great romantic dinner place.

properties.name: Jeanty at Jack's
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 615 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Charming atmosphere...sister restaurant to Bistro Jeanty in Yountville. Very affordable and romantic, yet still casual, a great option compared to pricier Jardiniere and Masa\'s. If you couldn\'t tell, I love French food!

properties.name: La Ciccia
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 291 30th St, San Francisco, CAReservations: 415.550.8114 So what the heck was I thinking having this on my \'places to try" list for so long? Seriously folks, this place absolutely gives A16 a run for its money as the best Italian in SF....but more importantly with a native Sardinian chef and family run business, the food specialization is like nothing else you\'ll find stateside. Discover this for yourself! The wine list is second to none, everything is amazing on the menu, and the desserts are fantastic. If there\'s one place on my Platial to go to, this is it, congratulations on finding my easter egg! :)

properties.name: Laszlo Bar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster2526 Mission St, San Francisco, CARussian Communist Bar....yes, you read it right...awesome place for a drink before going to Foreign Cinema next door, or Cha Cha Cha down the street. My favorite...try the Heat Seeker.

properties.name: Masa's
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 648 bush street, san franciscoReservations (OpenTable.com) One of the most celebrated restaurants in the country, Masa\'s delivers the highest end French cuisine comparing with Chez Panisse and the French Laundry. Of course with quality...comes price! For special occasions and romantic moments, Masa\'s can\'t be beat.

properties.name: Nectar Wine Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3330 Steiner St, San Francisco, CAUltra hip atmosphere wine bar off Chestnut...one of my favorite pure wine bar experiences where the focus is on wine and small food, not on being a restaurant. Very lush atmosphere and unique but comfortable seating makes it cozy but sexy. Good quality small plates with a fun and broad wine list. Try the pizzetta or pork medallions. Excellent cheese plate SF Gate Wine Bars #1 SF Gate Wine Bars #2

properties.name: Oola
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 860 Folsom St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Lounge styled restaurant is an understatement, down to the thumping music...but my interests stopped at the decor and ambiance, as the food was highly overpriced for comparable quality in the city, and the service was rude. Bottom line, hip joint, but too pricey for the food delivery.

properties.name: Pasta Moon
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 315 Main St, Half Moon Bay, CAPasta Moon (650) 726-5125

properties.name: Pescheria
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1708 Church St, San Francisco, CAReservations: (415) 647-3200 Casual coastal Italian cuisine in Noe Valley. Starting with the wine list, it consists of a fun unique selection of Italian, French, Spanish and Basque wines. Try the Txomin Extaniz Txakolina as a fantastic pairing with seafood. While the menu is actually small, absolutely everything is excellent. The arctic char on top of celery root puree covered with a poached egg is wonderful, and the butterfish sealed in parchment is an absolutely an inspiration in richness and warmth. I wasn\'t quite so fascinated with the desserts, I found the flavor balance a bit off compared to the main courses, and also a bit dry on the torte. The cannoli is probably the best choice here. Chronicle Review

properties.name: Philz Coffee
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  201 Berry St, San Francisco, CACoffee made with care, each cup made individually. You have to try with their special cream.

properties.name: Piperade
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1015 Battery St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Fantastic traditional Basque food with flair, a nice change from the typical French cuisine in the city. Definitely have the Piperade with poached eggs and cured ham. The wine list carries wonderful Basque Txacolina wines.

properties.name: Platanos
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 598 Guerrero St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Excellent Cucina Latina...very creative and fresh food, not your typical latin american fair. Everything is amazing, and don\'t forget to try to the plantains! Great pitchers of Sangria, always a favorite.

properties.name: Primo Patio Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  214 Townsend St, San Francisco, CAReservations: None needed...walk right in OK, favorite neighborhood place near the ballpark in South Beach. Best low-end food theory restaurant, you can\'t beat this place for the price, and you certainly can\'t beat their Caribbean food. They feature a very cute "middle of the block" patio that inset from the street. You\'ll miss this place if you don\'t look twice, it looks like a tiny little store front. You absolutely must try their Corn Cakes (amazing, never had anything like this), Jerk Chicken, and amazingly good fish dishes. I especially like their Ceviche and their fried Snapper Bits. White or red Sangria, and of course Red Stripe. If you\'re their for breakfast, try the Picadillo, another favorite.

properties.name: Restaurant LuLu
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 816 Folsom Street, 94107Reservations (OpenTable.com)

properties.name: Ritz Carlton Half Moon Bay
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1 Miramontes Point Rd, Half Moon Bay, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) OK...so I\'m not one to recommend hotels for food, but this new Ritz Carlton is a gem....visually stunning with views overlooking Half Moon Bay with waves crashing into the dramatic cliffs...and has THE BEST BRUNCH I\'ve ever tasted at the restaurant Navio. While pricey, it\'s an experience not to be missed. Also, the golf course is not to be missed for all you golfers.

properties.name: Rose Pistola
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 532 Columbus Avenue, San Francisco, CA, 94133Reservations (OpenTable.com) Super Italian food, not your typical North Beach place. Amazing wood fired pizza crust and very well prepared meat dishes. One of the city\'s most famous restaurants now.

properties.name: Rubicon
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 558 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Excellent California cuisine with a side of Italian....a De Niro-Coppola joint venture restaurant. Pricey, but worth a vist!

properties.name: Sam's Anchor Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  27 Main St, Tiburon, CAReservations for dinner only by calling (415) 435-4527, walk-ins with a short wait typically on the outdoor deck for brunch/lunch/drinks. Great weekend outdoor restaurant on a deck overlooking Tiburon and San Francisco Bay. Best place in the bay area to get drinks on a hot afternoon. Right next to the Ferry Docks, make sure to take the Ferry from Pier 39, it\'s a beatiful trip over.

properties.name: Slanted Door
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Reservations only by phone at (415) 861-8032 In the Ferry Plaza Building: 1 Ferry Building San Francisco, CA 94111 Incredibly innovative and flavorful Vietnamese fusion restaurant. Incredible Clay Pot dishes. Very difficult to get a table, recommend calling far ahead for reservations, or simply walking in during lunch to sit at the bar. If you are just wanting take away food, few know about "Out the Door", inside the main ferry plaza, where they have redefined fast food - the quality of Slanted Door and some of their best dishes, cheap and fast! Check out the Belgian beers and German Rieslings for a great food pairing. My favorites include the Imperial Rolls, Grapefruit Jicama Salad, Catfish Claypot, Cellophane Noodles, Chinese Broccoli or Green Bean side dishes.

properties.name: Slow Club
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2501 Mariposa St, San Francisco, CA, 94110Reservations: by calling 415-241-9390 Using specialty organic produce.

properties.name: South Food+Winebar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 330 Townsend, San Francisco, CAKiwis and Aussies oh my! An Australian & New Zealand food and wine focused joint....definitely a swank small small neighborhood vibe. Right across from the train station (and downstairs from my place, even better!)

properties.name: Suppenkuche
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 525 Laguna Street, San Francisco, CAWhile I\'ve never much been able to find fun and good quality german cuisine (even in Germany), it has certainly found a home in Hayes Valley. Fun, fun, fun...this place is warm and inviting, with a lot of communal seating which makes it very social, making it a great eating and drinking hall. Most importantly, they are home to the best German beer menu I\'ve seen stateside, and most on tap as well which is rare. The food is surprisingly good quality, making an incredibly light schnitzel, as well as a wonderful buttery and light spaezle. The black forest cake is also quite good.

properties.name: Terzo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3011 Steiner Street, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Awesome tapas style food from the chef from Rose Pistola. Fun environment.

properties.name: The Last Supper Club
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1199 Valencia St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Great southern Italian comfort food in a warm family style environment serving mid-size groups on long tables. Lots of great fall flavors, butternut squash, homemade pasta dishes.

properties.name: The Salt House
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 545 Mission St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Named after a famous pub in the UK, the folks from Town Hall have certainly upscaled the pub with Town hall. Housed in wonderfully restored old publishing house featuring the original brick, wood floors and metal and wood beams, it\'s a warm and inviting environment. The food is a great mix of casual style French and California cuisine...you must start with the Canadian styled Poutine which is potato wedges fried and covered with fontina and an rich beef gravy. Also had a wonderful Monk fish with Chard and braised Ox sauce, amazing Winter Squash soup with sage oil, and Pork Belly with Poached Egg on a mixed salad...overall each dish was very well balanced and creative "warm" flavors you won\'t typically find at restaurants in San Francisco. Very creative wine list, we had the Royal Tokaji from Hungary, a nice change. Most recent trip, I went the shellfish route, SH has an excellent selection of very fresh oysters. Also had the baked oysters which were good, but not great. Started with a white bean soup topped with pesto which was wonderful and very well balanced. The dungeness crab salad has an amazingly fresh appeal and is drenched in a great olive oil dressing. The foie gras torchon was quite good quality and matched with an excellent apricot reduction. Service was extraordinary, rare for a new restaurant to be this well tuned. Very catering as well to my young daughter who joined, made us feel at home.

properties.name: The Village Pub
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2967 Woodside Rd, Woodside, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) OK, so this is hardly a pub, but it is really a charming high end French and California cuisine twist on pub food with a great wine list. An excellent find in the hills of Woodside. A nice stop off after wine tasting in the Santa Cruz mountains.

properties.name: Ti Couz Creperie
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3108 16th St, San Francisco, CA 94103Being a savory crepes lover, I love going here for dinner. Certainly not your sidewalk crepes joint, Ti Couz has reinvented the crepe, spicing it up with many unique offerings. You have to love the mexican gourd jellyfish lamps, reminds me of Playa del Carmen.

properties.name: Town Hall
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 342 Howard St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) One of my favorite California cuisine restaurants...great mix of food, with really interesting flavor pairings you\'d never expect. The chef mixes in a bit of creole and soul food with excellent prepared meat and fish dishes. A couple of my favorite dishes are: * Barbequed Shrimp, Worstershire and parsely garlic sauce (starter) * Sweet onion and blue cheese fondue with fingerling potatoes, asparagus and cauliflower (starter) * Faith\'s warm Smithfield ham and cheese toast with poached egg and jalapeno cream (starter) * Sauteed day boat scallops with smoked andouille sausage jambalaya, basmati rice and crab butter * Slow-roasted duck with toasted wild rice, pecans, spiced dates and gingersnap gravy Great wine bar as well. Some great choices: * Rose, Jean-Luc Colombo, "Côte Bleue", Côte-du-Rhône, Rhône, France, 04 * Tempranillo, Rioja, 2002 (this was one of my favorite wines)

properties.name: Tres Agaves
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 130 Townsend St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) First true Tequila bar in the City. Try the Reposado Tequila Flights. Great deal, and you\'ll get to try all sorts of Tequilas you\'ve never had. And yes....Tequila is a sipping drink. Food is "just OK" not great for the price. Very fresh ingredients, just not that inventive.

properties.name: Wink
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1014 North Lamar, Austin, TX, 78703Wink to me is the best restaurant in Austin, delivering extraordinary quality French influenced cuisine using locally farmed ingredients. You can always count on a great Foie Gras dish, as well as wonderful chic comfort food. The wine selection is fantastic and carries over into the great Wink Wine Bar next door that also carries the same menu as the full restaurant. If you\'re looking for a casual but sexy wine bar experience, it\'s the place to go.
